intro: Sebastiania pachystachya var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-sepal sebastiania, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
